name: places/ChIJpX8FcFlYwokRCs3GXBqCBMM
formattedAddress: 345 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 345 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: My husband and I wanted a small city hall elopement wedding and we are so happy to have found Jocelyn! She is so wonderful to work with. From our first zoom meeting, Jocelyn gave us many suggestions such as hotels, hair/make up artists, and activities we could do for our photos. She was super organized and, throughout the whole process, she would remind us of things we needed to do/prepare before our wedding. On the day of the wedding, she made everything extremely smooth and comfortable. Our photos came out amazing - exactly what we were looking for: natural and authentic. Thank you Jocelyn!

originalText.text:
Jocelyn was an exceptionally on-point photographer who really cared about making our day special. We were very happy with the photos that came out, as were our chosen family and friends who attended!! She was very communicative, helpful, and engaging with us as a couple. She made sure that we were happy with everything and worked around our particular requests--she generated a specific schedule for us that made the day run smoothly and easily and I wouldn't have asked for anything better!! It was truly a perfect day. Would highly recommend, especially for a smaller wedding.

-Krista and Michael Hecht, married Friday, October 13, 2023

originalText.text: From the first communication to the end of the incredible day, Jocelyn was perfection. She worked to understand us as individuals, and as a couple, to ensure our wedding was the ideal representation of our union. She's professional while highly relatable, allowing our little family to quickly trust in her skills and relax enough to forget a camera was following us around Manhattan. We couldn't have asked for a better elopement photographer!

originalText.text:
My husband and I eloped at New York City Hall, just the two of us. We wanted to have a photoshoot to capture the experience and Everly Studios was one of the first to come up on Google. We met with Jocelyn Voo over Zoom before moving forward with working with her for our special day as our photographer and our witness.

Jocelyn was absolutely outstanding for more reasons than one. Firstly, we felt that she really "GOT" us, from start to finish. She listened to our vision (dark, moody, candid, casual, gritty) and as wild as some of our ideas were, she totally leaned in and delivered exactly what we were looking for!

Secondly, when you're eloping just the two of you, having a third person present is intimidating; what if it's awkward? What if the vibes are weird? But Jocelyn was an absolute joy to spend time with! I'd go so far as to say that her presence made the day even more special. She asked us about our love story, she joked around with us, and seemed genuinely interested in who we were as people. This also impacted the photos, as you can see how comfortable we are and how much fun we're having.

Third, Jocelyn is an expert at her craft, although not pretentiously so. Her website offers so much guidance on how the elopement process works. Her emails with us gave us contacts for who to reach out to for certain steps (We took pictures in the lobby of the Beekman and had to have permission granted; something we certainly wouldn't have known!) Not only did we consider Jocelyn our photographer, but our guide in the process of eloping.

She also is an expert in that her photo-taking does not appear obvious! I was worried about having professional pictures taken of me in public, but onlookers barely noticed as Jocelyn very naturally pulled her camera out and snapped pictures.

If you are eloping in NYC, there is simply no contest; Jocelyn at Everly Studios is your photographer. You won't regret it, and I genuinely believe our wedding day would not have been as smooth and enjoyable if it weren't for Jocelyn.

originalText.text: Jocelyn helped us plan (and re-plan) the perfect elopement wedding day! We just received our photo sneak peek of the day and it absolutely blew us both away. Jocelyn is talented, easy to work with, and exactly what you want in a wedding or elopement photographer. She even helped us re-prioritize photo locations during the day since we ended up with rain, wind, and quite a bit of chill.
